extensionDescription.message: Integrate VPN into Firefox: Exclude Tabs, set Site locations and more!

back.description: Alternative text attribute for back button.

titleServerList.description: Title for a dialog where users can set the location for a website.

titlePageSettings.description: The header for website specific settings, i.e. exclude a page from VPN.

excludePageFor.message: Always turn off VPN protection for $ORIGIN$
excludePageFor.description: Setting to exclude a website from VPN.

resetPageSettings.description: Button text to reset all site specific settings.

vpnIsOn.message: VPN protection for Firefox is on
vpnIsOn.description: Header to signal that VPN connection is enabled.

vpnIsOff.message: VPN protection for Firefox is off
vpnIsOff.description: Header to signal that VPN connection is disabled.

extensionVpnIsOff.message: Mozilla VPN is still on, protecting the rest of your computer.
extensionVpnIsOff.description: Popup subtitle when the extension VPN is off, but the client VPN is on.

vpnOffStatus.description: Label indicating that the VPN is off.

vpnOnStatus.description: Label indicating that the VPN is on.

placeholderSearchWebsites.description: Placeholder text for the search input field to search websites.

tableHeadingWebsite.description: Table heading for the column listing websites.

tableHeadingVpnStatus.description: Table heading for the column indicating whether the VPN is on or off for a website.

headlineNoWebsitePreferences.message: You haven’t set any website preferences yet
headlineNoWebsitePreferences.description: Headline shown when the user hasn’t set any website preferences.

noWebsitePreferencesSubText.message: With the Firefox extension, you can turn off Mozilla VPN protection for a website or set a custom location. To do this, visit a website, open the extension, and update the website preferences.
noWebsitePreferencesSubText.description: Subtext shown when there are no website preferences set by the user.

altTextRemoveWebsiteButton.description: Alternative text for the button that removes a website rule from the list of preferences.

altTextOpenSettingsPage.description: Alternative text for the button that opens the Extensions Settings page.

searchServer.description: Placeholder for the Input field where users can search the list of servers.

bodySubscribeNow2.message: We couldn’t find a subscription tied to the account you used to sign in on the Mozilla VPN app.
bodySubscribeNow2.description: Body of an error message, shown if the user is trying to use the extension without a subscription.

footerSubscribeNow.message: To use this extension, please subscribe.
footerSubscribeNow.description: Footer for bodySubscribeNow2, shown if the user is trying to use the extension without a subscription.

btnSubscribeNow.description: Call to action button for users to subscribe to Mozilla VPN.

getHelp.description: Text of a link pointing to a relevant help page.

headerSignedOut.message: Sign in to the Mozilla VPN app.

bodySignedOut.message: You’re currently signed out of the Mozilla VPN app. To use the Mozilla VPN Firefox extension, open the app on your computer and sign in to your account.

headerNeedsUpdate.description: This is the headline of an error panel.

bodyNeedsUpdate2.message: To use this extension, first download and install the latest Mozilla VPN app.
bodyNeedsUpdate2.description: This is body copy for an error message.

headerInstallMsg.description: Header if a VPN installation was not found.

bodyOpenMsg.message: To use the Mozilla VPN Firefox extension, please open the Mozilla VPN app first.

bodyInstallMsg.message: To use this extension, first download and install the Mozilla VPN app on your computer.

bodyInstallMsgFooter.message: Note that Mozilla VPN is a paid subscription service.

btnDownloadNow.description: This is a call to action button to download the VPN.

useDefaultLocationExplainer.message: Use the same location as the Mozilla VPN app protecting this computer.
useDefaultLocationExplainer.description: Explanation of what “Use default Mozilla VPN Location” means.

bodyUnsupportedOSMessage.message: Currently, the Mozilla VPN extension is only available on Windows devices.

footnoteUnsupportedOSMessage.message: We’re working to bring support to macOS and Linux soon!

websiteProtection.description: A subtitle that is followed by an off icon and the word 'Off'.

learnMore.description: Label of link that leads to SUMO.

onboarding1_title.message: Turn off VPN for specific websites

onboarding1_body.message: With the Firefox extension, you can turn off VPN protection for specific websites, while keeping it on for everything else.

onboarding2_title.message: See different websites from different locations

onboarding2_body.message: News from London. Sports from Sao Paulo. Shopping from Tokyo. Set website-specific locations for personalized browsing.

onboarding3_body.message: Use the extension to turn on VPN protection for Firefox — even when protection is off for the rest of your computer.

next.description: Label of button to progress to next onboarding panel.

skip.description: Label of button to skip onboarding.

done.description: Label of button in final onboarding panel.

headerReEnableFirefoxProtection.description: Error panel title for when Firefox is an excluded app.

bodyReEnableFirefoxProtection.message: Firefox is currently an “excluded app” in the Mozilla VPN application. To use this extension, open the application and go to Settings > Excluded Apps and remove Firefox.

settingsPageSubtitle.message: To add or change website-specific preferences, visit the site and open the Mozilla VPN Firefox extension. Then, set preferences for the site. Your preferences are only in effect when VPN protection for Firefox is on.

noSignal.description: Indicator text describing the status of the VPN.

unstable.description: Indicator text describing the status of the VPN.

connecting.description: Indicator text describing the status of the VPN.

websiteLocationLabel.description: Aria label for a flag icon representing the location of the VPN server

alert_conflictingProgram.message: A program on your computer may be causing issues with the Mozilla VPN extension.

alert_conflictingExtensions.message: Other extensions may be interfering with how the Mozilla VPN extension works.

telemetry_toggle_text.description: Label for the Telemetry Opt-In toggle

privacy_notice_link_name.description: Used as text of the link in 'telemetry_screen_descr'

first-install-body.message: To help us improve features and performance and resolve issues quickly, you can choose to allow the Mozilla VPN extension to collect data. The data we collect will never be tied to you and we never collect data about the sites you visit. Data collection does not impact how the extension works.
first-install-body.description: Body copy on the telemetry consent screen

privacyPolicyIntro.message: Full details of the data we collect are available in our privacy policy.
privacyPolicyIntro.description: Description of what can be found in the privacy policy. Blurb in the telemetry consent screen.

thankYouForAdding.message: Thank you for adding the Mozilla VPN extension
thankYouForAdding.description: Headline on the telemetry consent screen

toContinueToTheExtension.message: To continue to the extension, select the Mozilla VPN logo in the Firefox toolbar.
toContinueToTheExtension.description: Blurb at the bottom of the telemetry consent screen

optionalDataCollection.description: Subtitle on the telemetry consent screen

telemetryListHeader.message: The optional data we collect includes:
telemetryListHeader.description: Headline for a list describing the type of data collected by the extension

technicalData.message: Technical data, such as browser version, extension version, and error details so we can track and fix errors efficiently.
technicalData.description: Description of technical data, found on telemetry consent screen.

interactionData.message: Interaction data, such as the number of websites excluded from VPN protection, the number of websites with a location preference, and how often protection is turned on and off.
interactionData.description: Description of interaction data, found on the telemetry consent screen.

telemetryOptOutInstructions.message: If you don’t want to allow the Mozilla VPN extension to collect data, uncheck the box. You can also change this setting anytime in the extension, under Settings.
telemetryOptOutInstructions.description: Opt out instructions on the telemetry consent screen

telemetryCheckboxLabel.message: Allow Mozilla to collect technical and interaction data

telemetrySettingsCheckboxLabel.message: This data helps us improve features and performance. It includes data about your device, hardware configuration, and how you use the Mozilla VPN extension.
telemetrySettingsCheckboxLabel.description: Checkbox label on the settings page

messageSplitTunnelHeader.description: Header that is shown if the current Firefox is affected by Split-Tunneling

messageSplitTunnelBody.message: Firefox is currently an “excluded app” in the Mozilla VPN application. To use this extension, open the application and go to Settings > Excluded Apps and remove Firefox.
messageSplitTunnelBody.description: Helptext body that is shown if the current Firefox is affected by Split-Tunneling
